rydglek.title: Aether, Pt. 1
rydglek.about: Aether Pt. 1 is a multi-layered sonic tapestry where the artist explores the influence of Prurient's noise textures, filtering them through their own perspective. The album blends tense ambient layers, chaotic noise, and unexpected dance rhythms, creating an eclectic soundscape. Each track feels like an auditory landscape where the abstract intertwines with the dynamic, and the emotional merges with the industrial. Itâ€™s an invitation to a space where noise becomes melody, and melody transforms into vibrations that resonate deeply with the listener's inner feelings.

rydglek.title: Aether, Pt. 2
rydglek.about:
Aether, Pt. 2 is a deep dive into the realms of dark ambient, drone, and noise, continuing the conceptual journey of the Aether saga. Expanding upon the haunting minimalism of its predecessor, this release unfolds as an immersive sonic experienceâ€”where deep, resonant drones, distorted textures, and industrial noise dissolve into vast, hypnotic soundscapes.
Devoid of conventional structures, Aether, Pt. 2 focuses on pure atmosphere, evolving slowly in layers of immersive tension and meditative decay. It evokes feelings of isolation, weightlessness, and an eerie sense of detachment, making it a soundtrack for those seeking to lose themselves in the void.

rydglek.title: Arbeiterklasse
rydglek.about:
Arbeiterklasse is a new rydglek album, which was inspired by music of detroit techno groups Dopplereffekt and Der Zyklus and Berlin based techno duo Schwefelgelb. But rydglek hasn't lost his own prism of album productioning and he put all his creativity to this album. This creation by its sound reminds those techno rave bootlegs, that you have found on thrift market...
Recorded from April 20th, 2024 - May 15th, 2024.

rydglek.title: Carnot sykli
rydglek.about:
Carnot sykli is a sonic model of a cycle: precision, repetition, breakdown.
The album is built from fragments â€” pulsating noise, digital distortion, mechanical rhythms, and near-invisible textures.
There are no stable forms here. Everything is governed by internal thermodynamics â€” as if the sound itself decides when and how to decay.
Cold and calculated, yet charged with tension, the record moves from compressed minimalism into open zones of acoustic pressure. Microscopic details shape an overall sense of instability, with each track acting as a closed mechanism with its own function and limit of efficiency.
This is music on the verge of vanishing â€” it unfolds but never stays.
The cycle completes, heat dissipates, structure collapses.

rydglek.title: flesh to flesh
rydglek.about:
recorded on late May - early June 2025
"flesh to flesh", the latest album by experimental producer rydglek, invites listeners into a liminal zone where post-club textures meet emotional residue - a soundscape suspended between late summer evenings and unspoken connections. Itâ€™s a record that feels like sitting next to someone after the night has ended, when the city hums quietly in the background, and all that remains is breath, heat, and memory.
Sonically, "flesh to flesh" leans into a rich and tactile approach to sound design. The production is intentionally raw yet immaculately mixed â€” sweet in tone, but often unsettling in atmosphere. Gritty, haunted, and intimate, the album opens with a string of striking tracks that balance repetition and detail with hypnotic precision. This is music that pulses, decays, and reforms itself, echoing the emotional flatness and overstimulation of contemporary life.
While the second half of the album may feel more subdued - at times veering toward background listening - it still carries rydglekâ€™s unmistakable sense of mood. Thereâ€™s a careful push and pull between the immersive and the distant, the brutal and the tender.
Compared to earlier releases, "flesh to flesh" marks a significant evolution. It may not aim to dazzle with bold gestures, but its strength lies in restraint, atmosphere, and textural finesse. This is rydglek at his most refined - a haunted love letter to the spaces between bodies and the silence after the sound ends.

rydglek.title: garden zing
rydglek.about:
"garden zing EP" is a fragmented ode to urban bloom - a place where rusted rhythms meet delicate textures and basslines breathe like fog. Across these tracks, Rydglek weaves together atmospheric breaks, fractured club patterns, and distant echoes of techno, shaping an unstable yet intimate sonic world.
Both restless and reflective, the EP captures fleeting moments: early morning light on wet pavement, distorted memories of dancefloors, and nature leaking through concrete. Itâ€™s a fragile synthesis of emotion and abstraction - raw, resonant, and constantly slipping through your fingers.

rydglek.title: Rust
rydglek.about:
this album is very important to me because i was recording it during one of my best part of this year. too much energy, feelings i've put in this album.
recorded from november 2023 - december 2023
PRESS RELEASE:
Rust is one of many rydglek's album which is full of new experiences and experiments in styles: from Intelligent Dance Music to Witch House sounds, from Techno to Drone Ambient. Album is way more different from previous rydglek's albums, because of it's bass soundspaces and driveness. Release's background is full of energy and this release was also recording during most important for its creator part of the year. Many of feelings have put to this album.

rydglek.title: Suomen Soundgoodizer
rydglek.about:
ABRIDGED + REMASTERED
ORIGINALLY RELEASED ON DECEMBER, 10TH, 2022
Suomen Soundgoodizer is a deeply atmospheric release by Rydglek, blending Finnish cultural influences, minimalist soundscapes, and experimental electronic music. The album captures the essence of Nordic melancholy, weaving together soft synthesizers, organic textures, and intricate rhythms to create a unique sonic journey.
Through its evolving sound, the release evokes the stark beauty of winter landscapes, solitude, and introspection, transitioning seamlessly from quiet melancholy to serene liberation. The title reimagines the familiar term "Soundgoodizer" as a nod to Finlandâ€™s auditory aesthetics and the profound influence of its northern landscapes on sound design.

rydglek.title: textile fusion
rydglek.about:
The experimental music project Rydglek, known for its eclectic soundscapes and genre-bending approaches, announces the release of a new mixtape titled "Textile Fusion." This project highlights a unique method of music-making where each track forms part of a complex sonic tapestry woven from a variety of genres and styles.
Textile Fusion is an exploration of musical diversity and the fluidity of creative approaches. Each composition on the mixtape acts as a distinct thread, ultimately blending into a cohesive sonic fabric. From fractured rhythms and glitchy textures to minimalist ambient interludes, Rydglek masterfully mixes and combines genres, showcasing how music can be simultaneously layered and ever-changing.
Inspired by artists such as Aphex Twin, Autechre, Venetian Snares, and Kedr Livanskiy, Rydglek creates a soundscape where each element is an experiment. The mixtape's title reflects its concept: "Textile Fusion" hints at the textile structures where each thread serves a purpose, yet together they form a dynamic and unified pattern.
Listeners can expect an immersive musical journey through sonic layers, where no two elements repeat, and every track explores a new method of sonic construction and deconstruction. This release is perfect for those who enjoy discovering the new and the unexpected in experimental electronic music.

rydglek.title: to de0th
rydglek.about:
de0th was a 19 years old guy from sweden, RYM user and underground experimental music musician. he was into mostly noise, hnw and experimental music also he was one of my first fans. in may 17th he made his last activties on RYM site and discord. after it he wasnt online and recently it was reported that he passed away, presumably due to suicide in may 18th.
i dedicate this release and the new album (that im now recording, not Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ†Ğ°) in his honor.
rest in power.

Vampsecurity is the extended version of one of the most unusual EPs in rydglek's discography. This album is full of new interesting tracks, genres of those are really different: from drivey Drum 'n' Bass to unusual soundings of Intelligent Dance Music and club sounds of Techno. Album has been recording from December 2023 till January 2024, and this is the freshest release at this moment in discography.
